text: Can I create variables for colors in a file and use over multiple custom modules? I tried putting them in the theme css file with other variables, but it didn't work. Right now I declare the same variables in every module ..
I use my own CSS file and pull it from there, that did work as far as I remember. I think it's about the order it get loaded.

When an image is uploaded to HubSpot at say 1000x1000, but then the page displays it as /path-to-image?width=50&height=50… by using the resize_image_url() function…
Does this resized image get saved somewhere in the file system or does HubSpot have to perform resizing on the image every time the page is loaded?

It’s kinda magic. HS will create a static file (only available via the URL params though; it won’t show up as a dedicated file in the FM) but only after a couple of requests at that resolution and a bit of time.
Also, if you provide values for the width and height attributes of the HTML element, a srcset will be automatically generated

<@U26BLKGE4> very cool! So it sounds like after a couple requests/time, using the resize_image_url() function and/or width+height attributes will perform just as well as uploading a smaller file in the first place, if I understood that right
Correct! Only other caveat is that the image can’t be so large that the function can’t work. The longest size must be under 4096px
What’s everyone’s favorite page to look at every morning? I’d like to have something that’s like “Here are the things you need to do today”
Big Notion fan here, go Notion.

Hi. Does anyone know of a way to link to an HubSpot settings page without referencing the Hub ID directly? The expectation would be that they would be dropped off at the Portal Selection screen and then be redirected to their portal-specific settings page…
Notion? I mean in HubSpot itself, what’s the page you keep going back to look at?
I know was not the question considering HubSpot, but I like that one: <https://www.morningbrew.com/daily|https://www.morningbrew.com/daily> :relaxed:
What I’m looking for is some direction from HubSpot itself. Like who should I be reaching out to? What should I be following up on? That kind of thing
There isn't really a page like that for developers
is their Hub ID known to you as a property in your data?
No… this would be on public help pages where we tell people to go to a certain settings page. But we can’t link there because we don’t know their ID
ah, I see, sorry can't be of much help with that
